column4: cups web interface doesn't find a printer on the network, how do i add it manually?

when you add a new printer the first thing it does is try to auto detect printers....if it's on a network it may not find the printer the first go, so totally close the printing config app and try again
i tried that thing today at my placee of work n the network printer i wanted took 2 tries for it to find it
i've tried a few times using gnome-cups-manager, but it refuses to find it
manually adding the printer and using raw printing works, but i want auto-detection :)
if the manual setup worked then use it ;)
no i only get grayscale printing
maybe check the settings of the printer in the printer config
i mean the settings in ubuntu printer config
I've seen some drivers have colour as an option
If that doesn't work try selecting a driver that is similar to your printer
if that don't work try and get a hold of a PPD file from a windows/mac driver install and use that for your driver
actually i have a driver that exactly matches the printer model
well use that, if it don't work pick a similar matching one
